title: Alert!
author: JGray
text:
Readers who figure out what today's page title refers to get an official Mysteries of the Arcana no-prize!

I recently read through the Anime Encyclopedia. It was interesting, if slightly out of date. Bakugan, for example, was missing, but I learned a lot about the Mysterious Cities of Gold, Robotech, and even the Little Prince, all shows I watched as a kid.

replies.author: Ketira*Guest*
replies.text: Does using Google count?  I think I watched those movies, but then, there was a lot I watched in those days and don't remember until the name comes back to me.

replies.author: Rincewind*Guest*
replies.text: I'm guessing the title refers to the giant, jet-propelled turtle, GAMERA!

replies.author: Victor*Guest*
replies.text: Gamera is really neat, Gamera's made of turtle meat, we've been eating GA-MER-A!

replies.author: weertangel*Guest*
replies.text: Now thats a BIIGG turtle!! and yes, i have seen something like that before, just don't know where anymore. Btw, i forgot to mention that i like Cryst's safari clothing, purple suits her.

replies.author: JD
replies.text:
I think Keith said something about turtles being carnivorous...
The two of them look like tasty little people nuggets in that last panel.

replies.author: JGray
replies.text: Using Google counts. I do it all the time.And ya'll are right. Gamera IS full of turtle meat! Or people meat, if JD's right, since this one might snap up the gals...

replies.author: weertangel*Guest*
replies.text: I would't be suprised if there's an entire civilisation in his insides, he sure is big eneugh for it!!makes u wonder what he eats normally...(super giant whales or kelp??)

replies.author: Gesangbaer*Guest*
replies.text: Could it possibly be w reference to the turtle and owl from the old tootsie pop comercials? Mr Owl, who licks 1, 2, 3 ... chomp!

replies.author: Gesangbaer*Guest*
replies.text: Op! Never mind. Wrong comic title, hehehe.
